intro: Hieracium integratifrons, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy basal rosettes. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium integratifrons is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
